text:
Hi there, through _crm/v3/objects/deals/splits/batch/read_ API, I'm trying to extract the *deals split owner* data.

_"id"_ in _"inputs"_ is what I'm sending in the request body. However, it's providing the *HubSpot owner ID* rather than the d*eal split owner* name.
Is there a way for me to get the *deal split owner*?
> The Dev team confirmed there was a small issue and fixed it. Both the UI and row API show the correct number of rows now.
<@U06Q2Q86Y31> <@U07NTCF0Z37> did you were able to solve

Hi Everyone, We are looking into a way in how we can send invoices to our customers/partners in an automated fashion. The <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/commerce/invoices> is a read only API. Does anyone have ideas in how we can create automated invoices?

In a nutshell. We collect money for transactions, create an invoice (credit note) for this and pay out the partner through the bank.

We would want to find a way to create the invoices using HubSpot. Any thoughts?

Thank you :innocent:

Hello, I am trying to log a call thru this api <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/objects/calls>
but seems that it always returns an error which states that the app hasn't been granted all required scopes (including the list of scopes that is needed). I tried to add those scopes but seems it is still recognize and returns the same error.
Did I missed something?

yes.  In my case I was sending the stream when they hit me with their webhook.  That's not what they want.  The webhook is expecting a URL for them to use to then get the recording.  Their docs are a little misleading in my opinion because I think they were using the same url as the webhook in the webhook response.

1. Setup the webhook for your app (this is a one time thing)
2. Post an engagement (save the id)
3. Post to mark the recording as ready with the engagement id
4. When the HubSpot user hits play
    a. HubSpot hits your webhook
    b. Reply with a URL
    c. HubSpot will then load the recording from that URL
My problem was the url, I was sending query params in the url and HubSpot was replacing it

Hey everyone,

Is there a way to know through API what records are deleted for today  or yesterday from company,contacts,etc??
isnt this the expected response from HS?

Just found a weird bug in the API. On a custom object, I can still query for properties that have been fully deleted (not just archived). I created some holding properties to store data while I convert the type of the original property. I then deleted the holding properties. I'm re-using the same script I wrote from months ago, and when I ran it, I accidentally left those property names in the query. I figured the request would fail, but when I checked the output, data for those properties returned successfully.

I don't care too much, but it's not a great look in my opinion. No pressure. Just sharing in case anyone working at HubSpot sees this and wants to look into it.
And if you do that same call via postman does it work?

Hello Everyone,

I'm using zapier to get line items but facing a problem that Zapier's line item could not fetch the Line items at once and if I take the line items one by one, it is generating separate invoice for each line item. Is there any API through which I can access all the line items together?
Yes !
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/api/crm/objects/line-items#post-%2Fcrm%2Fv3%2Fobjects%2Fline_items%2Fbatch%2Fread>
So it is json even for a file upload?
Looks like this in Power Automate
No, Iâ€™ve added the CSV directly
Thank you <@U05R380MLMC>!

I was able to get the associated invoice and all the relevant properties. However, it turns out you can't update those Accounting properties on the deal record, even via API. Support says you can update some read only properties, but looks like not these. Why would HubSpot support upgrading to Operations Hub Professional or Enterprise to write custom-coded workflows if you can't update these properties no matter what?
<@U06K19BGMNE> went back to find the solution, unfortunately couldn't find anything :disappointed:

<@U07K4UEB9L5> All IPaaS will give you the same limitation as it's query-based fetching. You can get data one by one or at most, by batch via repeated API calls. If batch fulfills your needs, then you're good. If this continues to be an issue - you want to look into unified data synchronization. Something like Syncari gets you all the data so you can fetch any or all the data.
